13:29 <Cassadin> hi everybod  
13:30 <Cassadin> anyone could help me? after changing language settings my tomcat seem to crash. where can i undo the changes in the files of xwiki?

16:08 <vmassol> re http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-717 cool it means that Andreas is still using XWiki ;)  
16:09 <vmassol> ah no  
16:09 <vmassol> it was an old issue  
16:09 <vmassol> wait I'm mixing issues  
16:10 <vmassol> it \*does\* mean Andreas is still using XWiki! :)  
16:12 <tmortagne> :)  
16:12 <tmortagne> technically he is even using a custom 6.3-SNAPSHOT ;)  
16:12 <vmassol> nice  
16:49 <vmassol> hmm we store the AS in the main wiki DB AND in subwiki's DB too?  
16:50 <vmassol> seems to be what xwiki.cfg says  
16:50 <vmassol> for now I'll just save the mail statuses in the main wiki's DB only…  
16:52 <ClemensR> yes, it is stored in both wikis, but only the one in the main wiki seems to be used for display  
16:53 <ClemensR> has been useful when people migrate from a sub wiki to the main wiki of a separate installation, actually ...  
16:58 <lucaa> has quit  
17:00 <vmassol> thanks ClemensR  
17:00 <vmassol> strange that we store by default in both  
17:00 <vmassol> because it's more costly  
17:01 <ClemensR> it seems to be cheap enough, at least not so expensive that people complained ....  
17:10 <ClemensR> for XWIKI-11547 I need to add yet another lifting of a  com.xpn.xwiki.XWiki - method to the com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki class ...  
17:10 <ClemensR> namely the hasSectionEdit() ... in analogy to the getSectionEditingDepth()   I hope that is ok, or is that bad practice and there is a better way ?  
17:11 <ClemensR> the xwiki.js needs to access the config variable, and it is not running with programming rights ...
